channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: It's need a new bollards and road bumpers., 16th October
item.description:
On the left corner of 159 Hestrsway, where alleyway is. The brocken pillars are being removed and the holes was just filled over with tarmac. This is not the right solution! It needs a new bollard to protect pedestrians and houses from over speed drivers!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 184, Hesters Way Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead boughs in large tree above highway and pavement., 16th October
item.description:
Outside number 152 Hewlett Road. There are others along the street too. This is an ongoing issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking of high sided vehicles on a corner, 16th October
item.description:
Unable to see. Vehicles park on the junction of wisteria way and vervain close. Daily near misses. Witnessed a child nearly get knocked off their bike as it’s impossible to see clearly. Cars have to reverse back as they meet face to face as due to the height of the vans it’s impossible to see

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vervain Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 10/12” wide, 15th October
item.description:
The pothole is outside 31 Linden Avenue & getting deeper, it has been there for at least a month Difficult to avoid if a car is coming the other way
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Linden Avenue, Cheltenham

item.title: Dreadful state of road, 15th October
item.description:
This is totally ridiculous and unacceptable. The state of the road from the roundabout by the station to Malvern Road is dreadful. Everytime a lorry or bus passes by our houses shake. The road is a disgrace and dangerous for cyclists and drivers alike and has been this way for over 5 years. Shame on the County Council who waste money on pointless cycle schemes that cyclists do not want and continue to use the highway rather than over £20m infrastructure developed for them. Funny money can be found for things like the men’s cycling race that showcase on a national and international platform to show off the county but work won’t take place to satisfy residents needs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 214, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights and no work being carried out, 15th October
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights at the bottom of New Barn Lane hill have been there for almost a week yet no work carried out and no sign of any work that had been carried out or will be. Causing delays in the morning and evening as well as blocking the entrances of people’s homes on New Barn Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, New Barn Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No sign to use pedestrian underpass, 15th October
item.description:
